prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: Me. What more can I say? This is my third year as a young (but skilled!) lawyer.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 3
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin, and channeling prodigy. She has amazingly powerful spiritual abilities.
Character 4
Name: Adrian Andrews
Description: Head of planning, promotion, and security of the Treasures of Kurain Exhibit.
Character 5
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 6
Name: Mask☆DeMasque
Description: A flashy thief who steals valuable works of art. Sends a calling card before a heist.
Character 7
Name: Luke Atmey
Description: An Ace Detective. Has great powers of deduction, yet rarely makes sense.
Character 8
Name: Ron DeLite
Description: A young man who turned himself in as Mask☆DeMasque. A bit of a pitiful guy.
Character 9
Name: Desirée DeLite
Description: Ron DeLite's wife. Seems to be a very friendly and out-going lady.
Character 10
Name: Larry Butz
Description: My friend. I've known this trouble magnet ever since grade school.
Character 11
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 12
Name: Kane Bullard
Description: CEO of KB Security. His body was found inside his safe.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.
Evidence 2
Name: Treasure Exhibit Poster
Description: A poster for the Treasures of Kurain exhibit. The Sacred Urn of Kurain Village will be displayed in Lordly Tailor.
Evidence 3
Name: Ami Fey's Golden Statue
Description: A statue of the founder of the Kurain Channeling Technique. Is holding the Shichishito. A statue of the founder of the Kurain Channeling Technique. Moved the night of the crime. Carried into the basement warehouse the day of the crime. Moved again that night.
Evidence 4
Name: Sacred Urn
Description: One of the treasures of Kurain Village. Supposedly priceless, it looks like a plain old pot. One of the treasures of Kurain Village. Supposedly priceless, but has no monetary value. Found in the office of Luke Atmey. Has pink splotches all over it. Found in Atmey's Office. Covered in pink splotches, but it's the genuine article. Broken and repaired by Adrian 2 weeks ago, then replaced in its box. Kept out of sight.
Evidence 5
Name: DeMasque's Calling Card
Description: Sent before a heist, the emblem is top-secret. Click here for details.
Evidence 6
Name: Shichishito
Description: A ceremonial sword held in the hand of Ami Fey's statue. Wasn't bent before the crime. DeMasque knocked Atmey out during the crime w/ a blow to the back of the head.
Evidence 7
Name: Camera Data
Description: The warehouse camera went off at around 1 AM on the night of the crime.
Evidence 8
Name: Desirée's Letter
Description: Addressed to her husband Ron DeLite. Apparently contains something important.
Evidence 9
Name: Security Camera Photo
Description: Photo of storeroom entrance taken by the camera. Click here for details.
Evidence 10
Name: Blackmail Letter
Description: Written with a fountain pen. Found in Ron's room. Click here to read. Found in Ron DeLite's room. Written by Bullard. Click here to read.
Evidence 11
Name: Ron's Wallet
Description: Found by Larry at his part-time security job's company building (night of the crime).
The Sacred Urn of Kurain Village will be displayed in Lordly Tailor.
Evidence 12
Name: Key Card
Description: Found inside Ron's wallet. Apparently used for the building of his part-time job. Found in Ron's wallet. Opens the KB Security CEO's office. Leaves a record when used. Found in Ron's wallet. Used on October 12th, the night of the crime, at 1 AM.
The Sacred Urn of Kurain Village will be displayed in Lordly Tailor.
Evidence 13
Name: Publicity Photo
Description: A shot of Mask☆DeMasque striking a pose. Click here for details.
Evidence 14
Name: DeMasque's Broach
Description: Found in the shadow of Ami Fey's statue. Looks like it was torn off of some clothing.
Evidence 15
Name: Kane's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10/12 at 1 AM. Cause: Cerebral hemorrhaging from blunt trauma to the head.
Evidence 16
Name: Newspaper Clipping
Description: An article on Mask☆DeMasque's first heist. Click here for details. About first heist. Guard in photo is Ron DeLite. Click here for details.
Evidence 17
Name: CEO Office Buzzer
Description: Connected to the basement Security Guard Office. There are no fingerprints on it.
Evidence 18
Name: Kane's List
Description: Found on a table at the crime scene. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: Buzzer Record
Description: The buzzer went off once at 1:02 AM on October 12 in the CEO's office.
Evidence 20
Name: Ron's Testimony
Description: From DeMasque's 2nd heist on, he was stealing as directed by blackmail letters.
Evidence 21
Name: Urn Box
Description: A wooden box that had the Sacred Urn in it. Has pink paint stains on it.
Evidence 22
Name: Paint Marks
Description: Completely dry. The box of the Sacred Urn fits in the gap perfectly. When Adrian dropped the urn's box 2 weeks ago she also knocked over some paint.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: The truth is, I've been Mask☆DeMasque all along!
Person: Ron
Testimony 1
Testimony: I mean, you can't prove that I'm not actually Mask☆DeMasque, can you?
Person: Ron
Testimony 2
Testimony: I don't have an alibi for the night the urn was stolen, after all!
Person: Ron
Testimony 3
Testimony: I donned my costume that night and dancingly descended upon the scene of the crime!
Person: Ron
Testimony 4
Testimony: Look! You can see right there in the photo! That's me!
Person: Ron
Testimony 5
Testimony: As for my broach, I snagged it on the door handle and it got torn off, that's all!
Person: Ron

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The characters, evidences, and testimonies are all provided. Let me start by looking at the testimonies from Ron. He claims to be Mask☆DeMasque. Let's go through each testimony and cross-check with the evidence.

Testimony 0: Ron says he's been Mask☆DeMasque all along. Testimony 1 is about not being able to prove he's not, Testimony 2 says he has no alibi for the urn theft night. Testimony 3 says he put on the costume and went to the crime scene. Testimony 4 points to a photo showing him. Testimony 5 mentions the broach getting torn off.

Looking at the evidence, Evidence 16 is a newspaper clipping where the guard in the photo is Ron DeLite. Wait, if Ron was the guard in the first heist, how can he also be Mask☆DeMasque? Because Mask☆DeMasque would be the thief, not the guard. So if the first heist's guard is Ron, then he can't be the thief in that heist. But Ron claims to be the thief (Mask☆DeMasque) all along, starting from the second heist due to blackmail (Evidence 20: Ron's Testimony says from the second heist, he was stealing under blackmail). But the newspaper clipping (Evidence 16) shows that in the first heist, the guard was Ron. If Ron was the guard during the first heist, then he couldn't have been the thief then, but he's claiming to be Mask☆DeMasque all along. Wait, but according to Evidence 20, he started from the second heist. Maybe there's a contradiction here. Let me check Testimony 4 where Ron says "Look! You can see right there in the photo! That's me!" If the photo (maybe Evidence 13, the Publicity Photo) shows Mask☆DeMasque, but Evidence 16's photo from the first heist shows Ron as the guard, then Testimony 4's claim that he's in the photo (as DeMasque) contradicts Evidence 16 showing him as the guard in the first heist. Alternatively, if Testimony 4 refers to Evidence 13 (Publicity Photo of Mask☆DeMasque), then Ron is claiming to be in that photo, but Evidence 16's photo from the first heist shows him as a guard, which would mean he can't be both the guard and the thief in the same heist. So if Testimony 4 is pointing to Evidence 13's photo (Mask☆DeMasque's pose), but Evidence 16's photo from the first heist shows him as a guard, which would mean he wasn't the thief in the first heist. However, Ron's Testimony (Evidence 20) says that starting from the second heist, he was acting under blackmail. So if Testimony 4 refers to the first heist's photo, then there's a contradiction. But Testimony 4's person is Ron, and he's pointing to a photo (maybe Evidence 13, the publicity photo of DeMasque). However, the key here is that Evidence 16's newspaper clipping about the first heist has a photo where the guard is Ron. If Ron is claiming to be Mask☆DeMasque (the thief) in that photo, then that's a contradiction because he was the guard. But Testimony 4 says "Look! You can see right there in the photo! That's me!" If that photo is the publicity photo (Evidence 13), which is of the thief, then there's no direct contradiction. But perhaps if Testimony 4 refers to the Security Camera Photo (Evidence 9), which might show someone else. Alternatively, maybe the contradiction is with Testimony 3 where Ron says he donned the costume and went to the crime scene, but another piece of evidence contradicts that. Let's think about Evidence 12: Key Card found in Ron's wallet used on the night of the crime at 1 AM. If Ron was using the key card at 1 AM, maybe that's when the crime happened, but his Testimony 3 says he was at the crime scene in costume. But the key card's use is recorded. Wait, the Key Card (Evidence 12) is used at 1 AM, which is the same time as the camera data (Evidence 7) shows the warehouse camera going off. If Ron used the key card at 1 AM to access the CEO's office (Evidence 12), then he couldn't be at the crime scene (the warehouse) at the same time. So Testimony 3 where he says he was at the scene of the crime (the warehouse) when the camera went off (1 AM) contradicts Evidence 12's key card usage at the same time. That would mean he was in two places at once. So the Key Card (Evidence 12) shows he was using it at 1 AM in the CEO's office, but the camera data (Evidence 7) shows the warehouse camera went off at 1 AM. If the crime scene is the warehouse, then Ron's testimony that he was there (Testimony 3) contradicts the Key Card evidence showing he was using the key card at the same time elsewhere. Therefore, Evidence 12 and Testimony 3 contradict each other. That seems like a solid contradiction.

{"evidence": 12, "testimony": 3}
